Functionality.comm: Versatile for landscapes and low light.

cont.entity_a: Functions like a 32mm lens, making it versatile for photo and video.

Performance.comm: Sharp in low light due to f/2.8 aperture.

cont.entity_a: Great in low light with vivid color and sharpness at f/2.8.
Barely perceptible barrel distortion on a crop sensor camera, easily corrected in post.
Great image quality for video work.
cont.entity_b: Amazing image quality with fast autofocus.

Build Quality.comm: Fast focus and great build quality.

cont.entity_a: Solid build with metal and glass, not lightweight but preferable to cheaper lenses.
cont.entity_b: Build quality typical of Canon 'L' series.

cont.entity_a: Fast and accurate focus compared to other lenses.
cont.entity_b: Unclear focus compared to other Canon lenses.

cont.entity_a: Works well for landscapes and architecture photography.
Sharp photos with good field of view.
cont.entity_b: Some softness in corners but sharp in the center.

cont.entity_a: Affordable with good performance, though heavy vignetting and softness at corners noted.
Does not zoom, only focuses at one distance.
cont.entity_b: Bulky but produces magical pictures with minimal post-processing.

cont.entity_a: Super sharp and fast in low light.
cont.entity_b: Sharp, clear, colorful wide angle shots.

cont.entity_a: Colors can appear lifeless with burnt-out details.
Not worth more than $299, according to user.
Versatile despite fixed focal length, sharp in low light.
Solid build with metal and glass, not lightweight but preferable to cheaper lenses.
cont.entity_b: Heavy but provides excellent image quality.
Concerns about packaging and missing warranty information.

cont.entity_a: Heavy vignetting and softness at corners noted.
Prone to flaring, recommended to use a lens hood.
cont.entity_b: Requires ultrathin filters, which may not allow use of lens cap.
